page.title: 12100 years at Ditcham
page.content: the Cave family consisted of 2 parents and 5 children, who were supported by 14 indoor servants and 14 outdoor workers. For a 'Coming Out Ball' a special train ran from London to Ditcham. It stopped at Woodford, where the carriages met the guests. At 1am the driver whistled indicating he was departing. When a famous Polish pianist gave a recital aparticular make of piano was sent from London and hauoed up the steep hill from Petersfield. At Christmas Mrs Cave went to London to buy presents for the 100 children of the estate. the Caves left Ditcham in 1921 for Stones Hill. Then the house was used for Douai RC as a boys' preparatory school for 27 years. It was bought by a Bagshot based property dealer and it became the present school.
